isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Assembly

warning.para: To prevent serious eye injury, always wear safe eye protection when you perform vehicle maintenance or service.
Take care when you use silicone gasket materials to avoid serious personal injury. Follow the manufacturer's instructions to prevent irritation to the eyes and skin.

Small amounts of acid vapor are present when applying silicone gasket material. To prevent possible serious personal injury, make sure there is adequate ventilation in the work area. If silicone gasket material gets in your eyes, flush your eyes with water for 15 minutes. Have your eyes checked by a doctor.
Take care when you use Loctite' products to avoid serious personal injury. Follow the manufacturer's instructions to prevent irritation to the eyes and skin.

step1.para: Lubricate all bearing cups and cones, gears and shaft assemblies before installation into the case. Use synthetic SAE 50 oil (Meritor specification O-81).
With the inside of the front case facing UPWARD, install the single-gear, or rear output shaft on MTC-4208 and -4210 transfer cases, and double-gear idler shaft assemblies (Figure 42).
Position the clutch collar onto the stamped shift fork. Position the shift fork and clutch collar onto the front output shaft clutch hub.
Install the front output shaft, shift fork and clutch collar over the front output shaft tapered roller bearing in the front case (Figure 43).

figure.caption: Figure 43. Install Front Output Shaft, Shift Fork and Clutch Collar

step1.para: While holding the shift fork and clutch collar in place, insert the push rod through the case and through the stamped shift fork (Figure 44).
Temporarily install the shift cylinder onto the case to secure the push rod in place.
The shift cylinder requires Loctite® sealant for final assembly.
Install the release spring over the push rod and shift fork.
Install the high and low shift fork and shift shaft into position in the front case (Figure 45).
Determine all shaft bearing end plays before final assembly. Refer to the procedures in this section.
Install the two locating dowel pins in the corresponding holes in the front case.

figure.caption: Figure 45. Install Shift Fork and Shift Shaft

step1.para: Use a suitable lifting device to install the rear cover and output shaft as an assembly over the front case (Figure 46). Guide the cover over the shift fork and push rod as the cover is being set in place over the case.
Verify that the locating dowel pins have engaged both the case and the cover and that the cover is fully seated on the case.
Secure the case to the cover joint by assembling at least six equally spaced case-to-cover capscrews.
Assemble all remaining case-to-cover capscrews upon achieving correct end play measurement on all shafts.
Lubricate and install the O-ring in the rear cover push rod journal. Use a light coat of lithium based grease, Meritor specification O-688, prior to cover installation (Figure 47).
Apply Loctite® 518 sealant to the case-to-cover flange. Apply a 1/8-inch (3 mm) bead of sealant around the entire flange between each bolt hole making sure to encircle each hole.

Reinstall the rear cover over the front case. Guide the high and low shift shaft and push rod through the cover as necessary. Verify that the cover is aligned with the locating dowel pins and correctly seated.
If the capscrews are not pre-covered, apply Loctite® 272 sealant to the first three threads of the cover-to-case capscrews.
Install all cover-to-case capscrews and flat washers. Tighten the capscrews to 60-75 lb-ft (81-102 Nm).
